alert.note: Alert for Orange; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orange and west central Washington Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Paoli, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Orange and west central Washington Counties, including the following locations... Claysville, Bromer, Saltillo, Leipsic, Campbellsburg and Smedley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
